Name: Stela of Mentuhotep
Description: In the partly destroyed lunette can still be seen the remains of two udjat-eyes. Underneath them are three lines of text containing the offering formula. At the right-hand edge is a standing man with a vertical line of text behind him. A couple are shown In the centre section on the left, seated on a chair. Facing them are two offering bearers. The lower register contains six standing women. The accompanying texts with every scene are in columns. On the right edge there are two further men, standing.Some of the left part of the stela is gone. There are traces of paint.
